Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there, it's NASTY.”
Reviews.Author: Whitewolf7773
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the pool looked amazing although it was still too chilly for a swim. The room however, was about the worst hotel room I have ever seen. There was a huge wet spot in the comforter, my feet got black from walking across the carpet, and did I mention the 2 condom wrappers and the pill we found behind the night stand. This was seriously awful. For 20$ more we got a room at the laquinta on the other side of the interstate. Why is this dump still in business?

Reviews.Title: “Old and filthy”
Reviews.Author: Pickyonejustme
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here by choice. The "nicer hotel" next door where I originally booked my reservation was unable to accommodate me the first night of my stay (long and different story) due to a large group who did not check out that day. So they comped my room and put me in this place for one night on their dime. After 9pm, you cannot access the lobby and must use a small foyer with a night window in it to conduct business with the staff member. I will say she was very friendly and accommodating though. I knew I was going to be dissapointed in my stay when I observed about 20 semi trucks parked in the lot. Nothing against truckers but it gages, in my mind, the caliber of the establishment. On my way to the room, there were numerous bystanders hanging around in the shadows outside, which if I wasn't fully capable of protecting myself, might have me a bit concerned about safety. Of course my hunch was correct when I walked into the drab, extremely sparse and EXTREMELY dirty room. Carpet was absolutely filthy, the beds were old and uninviting, sheets had cigarette burns, pillows were dingy and flat, the dresser was worn out and badly weathered, the door had gaps all around it and was covered in dirty stains. The toilet had obviously not been cleaned as there were splatters of (yep, brown remnants) from the previous guest. Fortunately, I did not have to get close enough to that to concern myself during this very short night. The towels were a very unappealing shade of dirty white. The only good thing I can say about the room is the shower water pressure is excellent, but fine tuning the temperature is a challenge. If I had paid for this room, I would have asked for my money back and stayed elsewhere. As it was, I had got there late and this was my choice on someone elses dime. I just wanted to get some sleep and get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: JMargey
Reviews.Content: Bathroom gross, flitters everywhere, flying around. Toilet seat broken, no shampoos, one bar of soap. Sketchy area with the smell of "mary jane" wafting in the air. One night will do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS Find another place!!”
Reviews.Author: purplelover_12
Reviews.Content: I had over 50 huge bites on my body after staying here for one night. Breakfast had dry up store bought pastrys (2) and coffee. Getting out on the street is difficult. Not worth the savings. It is near Ihop and fast food and right off the freeway, had a nice pool, but not worth getting eaten alive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Savagebadwal
Reviews.Content: You guys, dont listen to these other stupid reviews i am a customer you can trust this hotel was amazing. Nice staff members no problems what so ever. Pool really clean, rooms clean, everything clean! i love the shuttle system i got to see around phx anytime. i recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for truckers and others”
Reviews.Author: Jim-OnTheWayHome
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time at this motel in three trips (it's the only stop that's been the same on all three trips). Other drivers I know have stayed at the EZ-8 for $29 in town, but too much rolled barbwire for me. Corp pricing keeps the price under $50, separate truck parking. The other two times I was here the truck lot was full, tonight it'll be about 1/4 full. As empty as it is, they say the only room they have is on the 3rd floor, no elevator on-site, not an issue for me but could be for some. Room would somewhere between a Super 8 and a Motel 6. Clean, but aging. Free WiFi. Today it was still 75 degrees at 8 PM in mid December and someone was using the outdoor pool, but not I. There is a shuttle and driver but I've never asked where/how far they will take people. (I just looked at their website and it says five miles, so that does NOT include the airport which is 12 miles). travelersinn-phoenix.com IHOP, Carl Jrs, one other in same parking lot. Truck-stop/convenience store across the street. End rooms overlook freeway, but I didn't notice the noise that night. The other two nights I've overlooked the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - Gross Rooms and Sketchy people”
Reviews.Author: jiggi21
Reviews.Content: Location: Right next to the highway which is great but there are lots of sketchy people hanging out around this place. Ladies of the night, bums, drunks and druggies all eyeballing you and harassing other people. The Room: Dirty, stained carpets, stained sheets, pee on the toilet, grease on and around the doorknob and door, looked like bloodstains on the back of the door. There was an overwhelming feeling of filth in the room. Service: Lady at the front desk barely spoke english and didn't understand procedures policies of the hotel. When I asked for a new room they said there was no other rooms, when I asked for a refund because I would not stay in the room, she didn't know what to do. When the service i used to book the hotel tried to contact them, the representative was hung up on three different times. Could never get a manager on the phone to resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: “would have left if I hadn't arrived so late”
Reviews.Author: HughF4
Reviews.Content: After driving from the Four Corners Monument, starting at about 6pm, I arrived at the Traveler's Inn in Phoenix at about 11:30pm. On walking into my 'non-smoking' room, I was nearly blown back by the stink of smoke. The TV remote had no batteries, and on switching it on manually I discovered that the last channel that had been watched was scrambled porn. I felt like sleeping standing up, with as little contact between myself and any part of the room. Not a good experience...

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: SoapinTrucker
Reviews.Content: This particular motel, is less than desirable for most folks, in my humble opinion. Though the property looks ok, and does have a nice pool area, there are other problems. The most important, is location. There are a LOT of bums and "ladies of the night" lately, and though the establishment provides a security guard, why would you stay at a place that requires one? More times than none, when you go from your room to your car, or to a nearby fast food place, you will be approached by questionable people, such as a street bum or local con-artist. The fact of the matter is, there are a lot of truckers in the area, and people needing money seem to gravitate to the area as well. The rooms do NOT have the usual amenities, such as shampoo, coffee maker, microwave, or clock radio, but they do have a 19" TV. The rooms also have minor broken or aged fixtures, walls, and fittings. I know for a fact there are much better motel/hotel choices in Phoenix, and STRONGLY recommend them! do your research of the area and motel choices before staying here, I am very serious!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: roomate3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a long drive from Dallas to California and stay at this Travelers Inn they treated us very well and went out of their way to may our stay pleasant. I was very pleased to find out that I did not have to worry about anything happening to our vehicle because they have 24hr. security. I would really recommend for anyone to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My experiance”
Reviews.Author: alwayzluvable
Reviews.Content: My newly wed husband and I had an outstanding experiance at the Travelers Inn in Phoenix Arizona. We were amazed by the courtious workers that went out of their way to make us feel as comfterable as possible. The Travelers Inn was well kept and clean. The pool was sparkling clean and the continental breakfast was to die for. I would recommend Travelers Inn to anyone who goes to visit the valley of the sun.

HotelInfo.Name: Traveler's Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5102 W. Latham Street, Phoenix, AZ 85043
